title: Table of values of derivative, no context part - c

content.description: Let f be a function that is twice differentiable for all real numbers. The table above gives values of f for selected points in the closed interval 2 ≤ x ≤ 13.
content.question: Use a left Riemann sum with subintervals indicated by the data in the table to approximate <math> <mrow> <munderover> <mstyle displaystyle="true" mathsize="140%"> <mo> ∫ </mo> </mstyle> <mn> 2 </mn> <mrow> <mn> 13 </mn> </mrow> </munderover> </mrow> </math> f(x)dx. Show the work that leads to your answer.

frqParts.text: Use a left Riemann sum with subintervals indicated by the data in the table to approximate <math> <mrow> <munderover> <mstyle displaystyle="true" mathsize="140%"> <mo> ∫ </mo> </mstyle> <mn> 2 </mn> <mrow> <mn> 13 </mn> </mrow> </munderover> </mrow> </math> f(x)dx. Show the work that leads to your answer.

skill.text: Skill 1.F: Explain how an approximated value relates to the actual value.
